title: Rodrigues
common: The surname Rodrigues does not have a unique origin, because it is a patronymic meaning "Rodrigo's son". This complexity conducts Américo Moura to list 18 different Rodrigues' families (Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 446-455).

families.name: Rodrigues - São Vicente
history: All data we have about this family is present in Brazil (Almeida, João M., 1886, pp. 351-357), and these documents do not bring any information about his origin.

people.name: António Rodrigues
history:
João M. de Almeida resumes the documentation we have and, as consequence what we know about António Rodrigues (Almeida, João M., 1886, pp. 351-357), this project simplifies the reader given the sources cited in the work:
  • He owns land near a Port named Naus (Leite, Serafim, 1956, pp. 461).
  • In his work about São Vicente, Marcos A. Lança informs us about an António Rodrigues' shipyard (Lança, Marco Antônio, 2005, 106-107).
  • The work about Pero Lopes de Sousa's diary also has a citation about António Rodrigues residence being near a Port (Sousa, Pero L., 1927, pp. 203, 208, 392).
  • The Friar Gaspar Madre de Deus informs us that Martim Afonso de Sousa gave the lands near to Tumiaru to António Rodrigues, he also give us information about a "porto de Tumiaru" and gave even more details about the São Vicente region (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 2010, pp. 37-38).

When we talk about his family, we do not have documents to prove the relationships, but Priest Jorge Moreira wrote some memories saying "... que com João Ramalho veio Antonio Rodrigues, o qual, diz o author, casara com uma filha de Piquerobi Cacique da aldêa de Hururay." (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441). Américo Moura worked with this family, informing that Luiz G. Silva Leme discovered, and published, a manuscript from Captain Diogo Gonçalves Moreira (Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 446), these data can be found in the First Volume of Luiz G. Silva Leme's work, where he calls attention that they are contradictory with Pedro Taques' suggestion (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume I, pp. 45-47). In the next generation, I describe how genetic helps us to confirm that at least one of his possible daughters are in fact indigenous.

marriages.name: Desconhecida / Antonia Rodrigues
history: According to Jorge Moreira's memories (Madre de Deus, Gaspar, Frei, 1840, pp. 441).

children.name: Gonçalo Rodrigues
history: According to Diogo Gonçalves Moreira's notes, that could be extracted from Padre Jorge Moreira's memories (Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 446), these notes were published by Luis G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume I, pp. 45-47).

children.name: Isabel Velho
history: According to Diogo Gonçalves Moreira's notes, that could be extracted from Padre Jorge Moreira's memories (Moura, Américo, 1951, pp. 446), these notes were published by Luis G. Silva Leme (Silva Leme, Luiz G., 1904, Volume I, pp. 45-47).
